definition: A term used to describe a form of communication that conveys a meaning contrary to its literal interpretation, often with a sarcastic or mocking tone. It is commonly employed to express humor, criticism, or to highlight the absurdity of a situation or statement.

examples.german: Das ist ja mal wieder typisch ironisch.
Seine ironische Bemerkung hat alle zum Lachen gebracht.
examples.english: His ironic remark made everyone laugh.

examples.german: Die Situation war so ironisch, dass ich lachen musste.
examples.english: The situation was so ironic that I had to laugh.

examples.german: Er hat ironisch gemeint, dass er der Beste sei.
examples.english: He meant ironically that he was the best.
